title: When viewing email, long subject lines are displayed as one row with top and bottom truncated.
creator: krtbuser
content:
When viewing email, either in preview or by double clicking from the list of emails, if the subject line is too long for one row, instead of either adding a row for display, or truncating the subject text, Tbird vertically centers the multi-line subject text, which cuts off the top and bottom of the lines. This makes it virtually unreadable. Is there a way to fix this?

Thanks, KR
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: How migrate Thunderbird from Win11 pc to different Linux Mint pc?
creator: pete.singleton.46
content:
I'm abandoning Windoze for Linux Mint Mate. The original Win11 Laptop is still available - no cloud connection, the Windows account exists but is unused. The laptop has all my Thunderbird v146.0.0 (64 bit) mail, address books, calendars.

I have a refurbished PC, came with new-install Win11. Now dual-booted as a Linux Mint 22.2, Mate desktop. The Win11 partition is unused and will stay that way for the foreseeable future.

I use gmail since TalkTalk finally terminated access to my Tiscali account. (I dropped TT many years ago.)

I've setup Thunderbird on Mint, can't see how to find its version. It came from the Mint default setups. Gmail is working but missing all the 'Local' stuff. The calendar has a few of my auto-repeat entries but none of the random ones. Some of my address books are missing.


I remember from the Win10 > Win11 migration that I need to move the 'profile'. It will be large but I have big-enough USB memory keys. And no, the machines are not network linked. I don't trust Microsoft and won't allow any of their corrupted stuff any access to my new kit.

Guidance needed:

  • What needs to be moved? From where on Win11?
  • Where to put the stuff on Mint. How to migrate it?
  • Any problems to watch out for?

Help please? Links to resources? Forum posts, online guides, wise words? Or 'just do it this way!'

TIA PeteS
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0

title: WORKING OFFLINE ON A COPY OF ALL EMAILS OF AN EMAIL ACCOUNT
creator: portishead9871
content:
Dear Sir/Madame/Miss...

I would like to download a copy of all the emails of an email account, without removing them from the server, work with these copes of the original emails without synchronizing my actions (e.g. sorting and/or deleting local copies of emails), archive selected emails and then export them in PDF (preferably), TXT or JPEG format.

Can I do what I am describing above, with thunderbird desktop?

Thank you for your time and expertise, and I wish you all a happy 2026!

Filippos

title: stopped  POP mail download to tbird 146 ( fm Jan 1) - No user presented failure indication
creator: hops89
content:
Discovered no mail download ( auto or manual) into tbird fm Jan1st, ( 146 updated mid Dec)

As others already reported eventually determined due some interaction with email virus checker (AVG) HoweverTbird not useful or helpful in providing to user any indication of problem or providing failure info.

Issue showed as 'Get email' not doing/showing anything - not showing pop3 login+download steps or anything else.. - saw one timeout popup wdw but usually nothing..

Error console showed an error message that "pop3 socket closed will not send info".... fine sfaigoes but have to go look for it.

Downgrade tbird version (145) even tho 146 working for 2 weeks before stopped) - same issue/problem (as per error log)

Direct access to server showed server end closing socket due multiple concurrent sockets open, indicating tbird and AVG.. reset AVG and reboot and restart and (145) now loading but....

Issue is that tbird should be presenting some failure indication to the user on socket connection failure ( wdw popup or message line status - where shows 'making connection";, "login, ...It doesnt show anything... so silent failure.... Just doesnt work ...

Unrelated but should also mention that error console display of 146 prior to above 'pop socket close' msg also shows failure of verification of a tbird extn due missing manifest file... There was only one extn in the extensions dir so Its that one (supplied with 146 installation) - clearly named with a random collection of alphanumeric and hyphen chars...

Cheers

title: Continuous Thunderbird SIGSEGV crashes on Linux (libxul.so)
creator: paull2
content:
Hi all, I'm experiencing persistent and reproducible segmentation fault crashes with both Thunderbird (versions 140.0.1, 141, and 142 tested) and Betterbird on Arch Linux. The crashes occur consistently within 30 seconds to 2 minutes of operation, making the application unusable.


System Configuration:

  • Arch Linux (fully updated)
  • KDE Plasma 6 on Wayland
  • Multi-monitor setup using DisplayLink/evdi drivers
  • Firefox works perfectly fine (no crashes)

What I've Already Tried:

  • Fresh profiles (completely clean - crashes persist)
  • Safe mode with add-ons disabled
  • Disabling hardware acceleration (MOZ_DISABLE_RDD_SANDBOX=1, --disable-gpu)
  • Software rendering mode
  • Multiple Thunderbird versions (140, 141, 142)
  • Alternative client (Betterbird) - same crashes
  • Full system upgrade

All crashes show the same signature in libxul.so during startup/operation. The stack traces consistently point to Mozilla's threading/compositor code. Notably, Firefox using the same libxul.so library works without any issues, which suggests this is Thunderbird-specific.

I believe the issue is related to KWin compositor interaction with my multi-monitor DisplayLink (evdi) setup on Wayland. The crashes are specific to Thunderbird/Betterbird and do not occur with Firefox, despite them sharing core libraries. Note that this problem happens on both x11 and Wayland.

I have extensive coredumpctl output available if that would be helpful for debugging. Has anyone else experienced similar crashes with multi-monitor setups or KWin/Wayland compositor issues?


Any assistance would be greatly appreciated!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;os:Arch Linux 6.18.3-arch1-1

Help please!

title: Two Copies of Emails in Sent (Outlook) & Can't Attach Files
creator: Techminator
content:
I see that any emails I sent using my outlook/microsoft account, two copies of that sent emails get generated under 'sent' folder when it should just be one so each time I have manually delete one copy. I have not seen this issue with other providers like Gmail, Yahoo or iCloud (Apple).

The other issue is which I have only started having today is that when I am trying to attach files the dialog box from which I can select the files open briefly for like 2 seconds (with no contents visible) and then disappears.

title: Thunderbird won't show gmail contacts.  Does show mail and calendar
creator: ken.barnett
content:
I have installed Thunderbird with Zorin 18 and it won't show contacts. Google says that Thunderbird has full access to contacts. Attempt to manually add contacts fails with message of "Can't connect to server". I did have to manually add the calendar to make that part work. Is this an uninstall and reinstall (Thunderbird that is) situation?

Thanks for your help

Ken

title: Emails, not showing up as read in Thunderbird, if marked read on server or read from iPhone
creator: oddcarout
content:
I read my emails on both my iPhone and Thunderbird (windows). I swear before the last update, if I read or delete an email on my iPhone, it would appear as read in Thunderbird, or be deleted. Now I am doing the work twice. I have checked my email server and the emails are marked read, or deleted there. I am sure that I am missing a setting but I have not been able to find it. I have searched here, google etc.

If anyone has a suggestion I would appreciate it.

Thank you,
